descript.abstract: U.S. Parks represents parks, gardens, and forests within the United States at national, state, county, regional, and local levels. These are areas covered with natural or almost natural land cover and designated for recreational and environmental purposes.
descript.purpose: U.S. Parks provides thousands of parks, gardens, and forests within the United States at national, state, county, regional, and especially local levels. Most parks, gardens, and forests are named.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, contact Esri by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing +1-888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at +1-909-792-0960; or visit https://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded. Email and chat are available through the Support page on My Esri (https://my.esri.com).
Outside the United States– Direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0. For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by email, telephone, or fax or write to us.

dataqual.logic: The dataset is converted to file geodatabase (FGDB) format using tools in ArcGIS. The geometry is checked, and if needed repaired.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the dataset is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Extracted the Land Use Areas dataset from TomTom MultiNet North America. Removed all fields except FEATTYP and NAME. Renamed field FEATTYP to MNFC. Selected the park features. Added field FEATTYPE and derived its values from MultiNet display type descriptions. Added field SQMI and calculated its values.

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent parks, gardens, and forests within the United States at national, state, county, regional, and local levels. These are areas covered with natural or almost natural land cover and designated for recreational and environmental purposes.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The official name of the park.
The feature type description of the park.

edom.edomvd: The feature type is a national park, garden, or forest.
The feature type is a state park, garden, or forest.
The feature type is a county park, garden, or forest.
The feature type is a regional park, garden, or forest.
The feature type is a local park, garden, or forest.

attr.attrdef: The MultiNet feature type code of the park.
The area of the park in square miles using the North America Albers Equal Area Conic projection.
Length of feature in internal units.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States, contact the Esri Sales staff at +1-800-447-9778 or visit https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=1 for more information about our software and data.
Outside the United States, direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at https://www.esri.com/en-us/contact#c=us&t=0.

distinfo.distliab: See access and use constraints information.

digtinfo.formcont: To use this data requires software that works with FGDB files.

stdorder.ordering: Data and Maps is available only as part of ArcGIS® software.
